botanical_details.genus: Ribes can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs, sometimes spiny, with simple, usually palmately lobed leaves and small tubular or bell-shaped, solitary or racemose flowers borne in spring or summer, followed by juicy, sometimes edible berries

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow as a multi-stemmed bush in a soil enriched with well-rotted manure or compost. Tolerates a range of soils including slightly alkaline ones. Add a balanced general fertiliser and additional nitrogen in spring
how_to_grow.propagation: propagate by hardwood cuttings in the dormant season
how_to_grow.pruning: Prune blackcurrants when dormant, from late autumn to late winter. Fruit forms on young wood, so when pruning aim to remove older wood, leaving the young shoots
how_to_grow.pests: Blackcurrants are susceptible to gall mites, gall midges, scale insects, aphids and reversion
how_to_grow.diseases: Has resistance to American gooseberry mildew
